content.question: A block of mass <math alttext="M" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></math> is at rest on a ramp that is inclined at an angle <math alttext="theta" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Î¸</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> with respect to the horizontal. Frictional forces are considered to be nonnegligible. The block is pushed against a spring and then held in place. The spring is compressed a distance of <math alttext="x sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math>, and the spring is not secured to the block. The block is then released from rest, travels up the incline, and comes to rest after traveling a distance <math alttext="D" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>D</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, as shown above. Which of the following claims correctly describes the energy of the system under consideration from when the block compressed the spring and when the block has traveled a distance <math alttext="D" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>D</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> along the incline? Select two answers.

choices.label: The mechanical energy of the system consisting of the spring increases by <math alttext="one half, k x sub 1 squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>k</mi><msubsup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The mechanical energy of the system consisting of the block does not change.

The mechanical energy of the system consisting of the block and Earth increases by more than zero but less than <math alttext="one half, k x sub 1 squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>k</mi><msubsup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The mechanical energy of the system consisting of the spring, block, and Earth increases by <math alttext="one half, k x sub 1 squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>k</mi><msubsup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The mechanical energy of the system consisting of the block does not change.

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
